title: How to eat your way around France's tastiest city
text:
The world’s only cultural centre devoted to fine food could only be in one city. Anthony Peregrine gets a taste of what’s on offer

Three questions: there are how many varieties of tomato? If on the Curanto trail, where would you be? And which insect is most commonly consumed by humans? If you’re struggling, then you could use a visit to the Cité Internationale de la Gastronomie (International Gastronomy Centre: CIG), which answers several zillion such food-related questions.

It opens grandly in Lyon next Saturday in what was, up to 2010, the city’s key hospital, the Hôtel-Dieu. Bang in the centre of Lyon, this is a sense-smackingly monumental building, easily mistaken for the parliament of a...
